Comments_List: The strength is what I learned from this course is helpful and could not gain from other courses. The weakness is that the course is focusing on a project, however, some knowledge points related to the project are not covered (enough) before we started the project.
Great for understanding and starting to write papers.
Good, it could be better to help the students to publish the project
This course is really helpful to improve my writing skills
the course is a too long(two semester). Some of the knowledge should be covered before the final project.

The instructors provided well-prepared lectures, and were approachable and willing to spend time on interacting with students. The strength of this course was that it helped us, in a detailed way, to improve our writing and analytic skills. The lecture on journal publication and review was interesting. I would suggest that more topics (and advanced techniques) in real-world analyses and/or perhaps scientific research/publication be added to this course (since current lectures on missing data/confounding/study design etc were somehow overlapping what we learnt in other courses).

Fairly OK, needs some improvements.

I think the individual project is a great pressure for both instructors and students. The data constraints at the beginning were really stringent so many students were unable to find clinical data. Then the requirements of the data and proposal shifted which led to various projects forced to fit under one model. And the in the end, there were some students' projects are not in instructors' expertise so there were many back and forth. I know constructing a course from scratch is hard. Below are some suggestions. The form of the course can change. For example, provide some data source and potential directions for students in an area that the instructors are familiar with. In this way, the instructor could give in-depth comments on both writing and content. As for a consulting course, could add more "consulting" element. For instant, like the instructors did last semester, bring an actual client to the course and let students feel the consulting process. Or, introducing "fake" clients, and throw out some questions for students to answer.

Strength: Professors really cared about their students. I enjoyed their office hours and one-to-one meeting.
Improvement: I would suggest a new format for this course. The idea originated from a site for data competition named Kaggle. The students can be assigned to different groups. They can have a semester to improve their prediction results and compete on the accuracy on Kaggle. At the end of the course, each team can have an opportunity to present their approaches and results. I hope this suggestion could contribute to the future development of this course.

This course gave us a chance to do an independent project and exposed us to fundamental concepts of clinical trial.
However, most skills in this course is not so useful to the students in Department of Biostatistics. So I recommend to transfer this course from compulsory class to optional class.
he is very helpful and patient
Dr. Dziura provided many helpful comments for the technical part of my project.
Provide many great opinions and suggestions about students' projects.
James is an expert in sample size. I learned a lot from his guidance of sample size calculation.
James is a very responsible instructor. He gave me many great suggestions for my write-up.
wish the slides weren't made by screenshots, it's very hard to read in class.
Thanks for Lisa's kindly help! I really appreciate her suggestions!
Dr. Calvocoressi was very patient and helped us a lot in improving our writing.
Very devoted. Spend tremendous time on helping students with their writing skills.
Lisa is really responsible and helped me a lot in writing.
I really enjoyed talking with Lisa. She is very kind and nice. I truly learned a lot from her office hours.
Lisa is a very responsible and supportive instructor.
If I ever learned anything from this course, it was from her. She was very patient in reviewing our writings and gave very helpful advice.
He is very nice and experienced
Dr. Peduzzi provided interesting comments in the lectures.
Experienced instructor with a lot to share.
Peter is an expert in the field. He provided deep insight into the field.
He constantly checks his phone when all students were forbidden to use any electronic device.
The course is too long. I think one sememeter is enough.
I learned a lot from this course and I am willing to recommend this to others.
The course is good and should be must-have. However it took a long time and can be intergrated into one semester.

This course would help a student build up a broad overview of some basics in data analysis, and addresses many common issues/difficulties in real-world application. It would be helpful for a student who is interested in developing related skills and gaining experience in empirical tasks. I would suggest students with corresponding interests and needs to take it.
It is a required course and it is improving.

Strength: Professors really cared about their students. I enjoyed their office hours and one-to-one meeting.
Improvement: I would suggest a new format for this course. The idea originated from a site for data competition named Kaggle. The students can be assigned to different groups. They can have a semester to improve their prediction results and compete on the accuracy on Kaggle. At the end of the course, each team can have an opportunity to present their approaches and results. I hope this suggestion could contribute to the future development of this course.

I can feel that all instructors are trying their best to improve this course and it is more effective than the last semester. But I still think this course is not so useful and should not last as long as one year. During this year, this course introduces several concepts and formulas such as PICO and sample size calculation. But it seems that the whole course is not well-organized. And for most students in biostatistics, such content is quite simple and should be finished in a few classes. Thus, in my opinion, this course could be compressed into one semester. And although it is called consulting lab, I do not think it taught so much about how to communicate with collaborators. We spent the majority of time in doing an independent work.
a course can improve your writing and conduct data analysis on a real world problem
I wouldn't. To be honest, this is the least favorable course I have ever taken at Yale, or even in United State... You get the idea.
